TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit HttpCachePolicy extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Contains methods for setting cache-specific HTTP headers and for controlling the ASP.NET page output cache.

remarks.format: ## Remarks For background information about HTTP headers and controlling caching, see RFC 2616: Hypertext Transfer Protocol -- HTTP/1.1, available on the [World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) Web site](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=37125).

MemberSignature.Value: public void AddValidationCallback (System.Web.HttpCacheValidateHandler handler, object data);
.method public hidebysig instance void AddValidationCallback(class System.Web.HttpCacheValidateHandler handler, object data) cil managed

Docs.param: The arbitrary user-supplied data that is passed back to the AddValidationCallback delegate.
Docs.summary: Registers a validation callback for the current response.

remarks.format:
## Remarks TheAddValidationCallback method provides a mechanism to check the response programmatically in the cache before the response is returned to the client by the output cache.
Before the response is served from the Web server cache, all registered handlers are queried to ensure resource validity. If any handler sets a flag indicating that the cached response is not valid, the entry is marked as not valid and expelled from the cache. In this case, as well as when any handler indicates that the cached response should be ignored for this request, the request is then handled as if it were a cache miss.
AddValidationCallback is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to add a delegate to validate a request based on query string values.
[!code-cs[Cache Validation Callback#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/4d4b984f-e7c2-4d53-acbf-_1.aspx)] [!code-vb[Cache Validation Callback#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/4d4b984f-e7c2-4d53-acbf-_1.aspx)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void AppendCacheExtension(string extension) cil managed

Docs.param: The text to append to the header.
Docs.summary: Appends the specified text to the HTTP header.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If the browser does not recognize cache control directives or extensions, the browser must ignore the unrecognized terms. For more information, see RFC 2616: Hypertext Transfer Protocol -- HTTP/1.1, available on the [World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) Web site](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=37125).
AppendCacheExtension is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
## Examples The following code example demonstrates the use of a cache-control extension supported by Internet Explorer. The server is indicating to the browser that the content will not change for one hour (`pre-check=3600`) and instructs it to retrieve the content directly from the local cache. However, if the content is modified by the server and the page is requested by the user within a fifteen-minute (`post-check= 900`) to one-hour period, the browser displays the information found in the local cache but also performs a background check and optional fetch of the new content on the server.
[!code-cs[Classic HttpCachePolicy.AppendCacheExtension Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/m-system.web.httpcachepo_3_1.cs)] [!code-vb[Classic HttpCachePolicy.AppendCacheExtension Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/m-system.web.httpcachepo_3_1.vb)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void SetAllowResponseInBrowserHistory(bool allow) cil managed

Docs.param: to direct the client browser to store responses in the History folder; otherwise . The default is .
Docs.summary: Makes the response is available in the client browser History cache, regardless of the setting made on the server, when the parameter is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks When <xref:System.Web.HttpCacheability> is set to <xref:System.Web.HttpCacheability> or <xref:System.Web.HttpCacheability> the `Expires` HTTP header is by default set to -1; this tells the client not to cache responses in the History folder, so that when you use the back/forward buttons the client requests a new version of the response each time. You can override this behavior by calling the SetAllowResponseInBrowserHistory method with the `allow` parameter set to `true`.
If <xref:System.Web.HttpCacheability> is set to values other than <xref:System.Web.HttpCacheability> or <xref:System.Web.HttpCacheability>, calling the SetAllowResponseInBrowserHistory method with either value for `allow` has no effect.
SetAllowResponseInBrowserHistory is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to override the SetAllowResponseInBrowserHistory method to direct the client to store the responses in its history in a custom <xref:System.Web.HttpCachePolicy>.
[!code-cs[HttpCachePolicySetAllowResponseInBrowserHistory#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/m-system.web.httpcachepo_10_1.aspx)] [!code-vb[HttpCachePolicySetAllowResponseInBrowserHistory#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/m-system.web.httpcachepo_10_1.aspx)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void SetCacheability(valuetype System.Web.HttpCacheability cacheability) cil managed

Docs.summary: Sets the header to one of the values of .

remarks.format:
## Remarks SetCacheability is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to set the `Cache-Control` header to the enumerated value for `no-cache`.
[!code-vb[Classic HttpCachePolicy.SetCacheability Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/m-system.web.httpcachepo_8_1.vb)] [!code-cs[Classic HttpCachePolicy.SetCacheability Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/m-system.web.httpcachepo_8_1.cs)]

MemberSignature.Value: public void SetCacheability (System.Web.HttpCacheability cacheability, string field);
.method public hidebysig instance void SetCacheability(valuetype System.Web.HttpCacheability cacheability, string field) cil managed

Docs.param: The enumeration value to set the header to.
The cache control extension to add to the header.
Docs.summary: Sets the header to one of the values of and appends an extension to the directive.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The field name extension is valid only when used with the `private` or `no-cache` directives. For more information, see RFC 2616: Hypertext Transfer Protocol -- HTTP/1.1, available on the [World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) Web site](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=37125).
This method will throw an invalid argument exception if incompatible directives and extensions are combined.
SetCacheability is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how the `Cache-Control` header is set to the enumeration value `private` and adds a cache-control extension. The modified directive means that in addition to any non-shared cache, any cache shared only by members of the community named "DEV" may cache the response.
[!code-vb[Classic HttpCachePolicy.SetCacheability1 Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/16566bce-c066-4578-8ca0-_1.vb)] [!code-cs[Classic HttpCachePolicy.SetCacheability1 Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/16566bce-c066-4578-8ca0-_1.cs)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void SetETag(string etag) cil managed

Docs.param: The text to use for the header.
Docs.summary: Sets the HTTP header to the specified string.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The `ETag` header is a unique identifier for a specific version of a document. It is used by clients to validate client-cached content to avoid requesting it again. Once an `ETag` header is set, subsequent attempts to set it fail and an exception is thrown.
SetETag is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to set the `ETag` header to a custom value.
[!code-cs[Classic HttpCachePolicy.SetETag Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/m-system.web.httpcachepo_1_1.cs)] [!code-vb[Classic HttpCachePolicy.SetETag Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/m-system.web.httpcachepo_1_1.vb)]

Docs.exception:
The header has already been set.
\- or -
The <xref:System.Web.HttpCachePolicy.SetETagFromFileDependencies%2A> has already been called.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void SetETagFromFileDependencies() cil managed

Docs.summary: Sets the HTTP header based on the time stamps of the handler's file dependencies.

remarks.format:
## Remarks TheSetETagFromFileDependencies method sets the `ETag` header by retrieving the last modified time stamps of all files on which the handler is dependent, combining all file names and time stamps into a single string, then hashing that string into a single digest that is used as the `ETag`.
SetETagFromFileDependencies is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to set the `ETag` header.
[!code-vb[Classic HttpCachePolicy.SetETagFromFileDependencies Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/m-system.web.httpcachepo_12_1.vb)] [!code-cs[Classic HttpCachePolicy.SetETagFromFileDependencies Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/m-system.web.httpcachepo_12_1.cs)]

Docs.exception: The header has already been set.

Docs.param: The new <xref:System.DateTime> value for the header.
Docs.summary: Sets the HTTP header to the <xref:System.DateTime> value supplied.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The `Last-Modified` HTTP header time stamps the document with the `DateTime` value indicating when the document was last modified.
This method will fail if the caching restrictiveness hierarchy is violated.
SetLastModified is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to set the `Last-Modified` header to a new date.
[!code-cs[Classic HttpCachePolicy.SetLastModified Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/m-system.web.httpcachepo_4_1.cs)] [!code-vb[Classic HttpCachePolicy.SetLastModified Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/m-system.web.httpcachepo_4_1.vb)]

Docs.summary: Sets the HTTP header based on the time stamps of the handler's file dependencies.

remarks.format:

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void SetMaxAge(valuetype System.TimeSpan delta) cil managed

Docs.param: The time span used to set the - header.
Docs.summary: Sets the HTTP header based on the specified time span.

remarks.format:
## Remarks `Max-age` is the maximum absolute time a document is allowed to exist before being considered stale.
The SetMaxAge method does not use sliding expiration and will fail if the expiration date violates the principle of restrictiveness.
SetMaxAge is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
> [!NOTE] > If the SetMaxAge method is called repeatedly, on the second and subsequent calls, the value of the maximum age can only be decreased.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to set the `Cache-Control: max-age` header to 0 hours, 30 minutes, and 0 seconds.
[!code-cs[Classic HttpCachePolicy.SetMaxAge Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/m-system.web.httpcachepo_9_1.cs)] [!code-vb[Classic HttpCachePolicy.SetMaxAge Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/m-system.web.httpcachepo_9_1.vb)]

Docs.exception: is less than 0 or greater than one year.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void SetNoServerCaching() cil managed

Docs.summary: Stops all origin-server caching for the current response.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Explicitly denies caching of the document on the origin-server. Once set, all requests for the document are fully processed. When this method is invoked, caching cannot be re-enabled for the current response.
SetNoServerCaching is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to disable output caching for the remainder of the response.
[!code-vb[Classic HttpCachePolicy.SetNoServerCaching Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/m-system.web.httpcachepo_7_1.vb)] [!code-cs[Classic HttpCachePolicy.SetNoServerCaching Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/m-system.web.httpcachepo_7_1.cs)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void SetNoStore() cil managed

Docs.summary: Sets the HTTP header.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the SetNoStore method of the <xref:System.Web.HttpCachePolicy> class to direct the client not to store the responses in its history.
[!code-cs[HttpCachePolicySetNoStore#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/m-system.web.httpcachepo_14_1.aspx)] [!code-vb[HttpCachePolicySetNoStore#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/m-system.web.httpcachepo_14_1.aspx)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void SetNoTransforms() cil managed

Docs.summary: Sets the HTTP header.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The `Cache-Control: no-transform` HTTP header instructs network caching applications not to modify the document.
The `Cache-Control: no-transform` HTTP header prevents downstream proxy servers from changing any header values specified by the `Content-Encoding`, `Content-Range`, or `Content-Type` headers (this includes the entity body). For example, it prevents proxies from converting GIF images to PNG.
As with other restrictions on caching, once SetNoTransforms is called, the `Cache-Control: no-transform` HTTP header cannot be disabled through the <xref:System.Web.HttpCachePolicy> interface.
SetNoTransforms is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to send the `Cache-Control: no-transform` directive with the current response.
[!code-vb[Classic HttpCachePolicy.SetNoTransforms Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/m-system.web.httpcachepo_6_1.vb)] [!code-cs[Classic HttpCachePolicy.SetNoTransforms Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/m-system.web.httpcachepo_6_1.cs)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void SetOmitVaryStar(bool omit) cil managed

Docs.param: to direct the to not use the * value for its <xref:System.Web.HttpCachePolicy.VaryByHeaders%2A> property; otherwise, .
Docs.summary: Specifies whether the response should contain the header when varying by parameters.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method allows you to prevent the output ached from adding a `vary:*` header to the outgoing response when the cached response varies by parameter. This is useful for clients varying caching by query string because most clients will automatically vary by query string without requiring the `vary:*` header.
> [!NOTE] > The use of the `vary:*` header can disable all client caching.
This is a convenience method to affect the <xref:System.Web.HttpCachePolicy.VaryByHeaders%2A> property. Passing `true` to the method directs the <xref:System.Web.HttpCachePolicy> to ignore the * value for the <xref:System.Web.HttpCachePolicy.VaryByHeaders%2A> property.
SetOmitVaryStar is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).

Docs.summary: Sets the HTTP header based on the specified time span.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The SetProxyMaxAge method does not use sliding expiration and will fail if the expiration date violates the principle of restrictiveness.
SetProxyMaxAge is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to set the `Cache-Control: s-maxage` header to 0 hours, 30 minutes, and 0 seconds.

Docs.summary: Sets the HTTP header to either the or the directives based on the supplied enumeration value.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The default, which is equivalent to <xref:System.Web.HttpCacheRevalidation>, is to send neither directive in a header unless explicitly specified by this method.
SetRevalidation is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to set cache revalidation to <xref:System.Web.HttpCacheRevalidation>.
[!code-vb[Classic HttpCachePolicy.SetRevalidation Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/m-system.web.httpcachepo_16_1.vb)] [!code-cs[Classic HttpCachePolicy.SetRevalidation Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/m-system.web.httpcachepo_16_1.cs)]

Docs.exception: is not one of the enumeration values.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void SetSlidingExpiration(bool slide) cil managed

Docs.summary: Sets cache expiration to from absolute to sliding.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When cache expiration is set to sliding, the `Cache-Control` HTTP header will be renewed with each response. This expiration mode is identical to the IIS configuration option to add an expiration header to all output set relative to the current time.
If you explicitly set sliding expiration to off (`false`), that setting will be preserved and any attempts to enable sliding expiration will silently fail. This method does not directly map to an HTTP header. It is used by subsequent modules or worker requests to set origin-server cache policy.
SetSlidingExpiration is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to set sliding expiration to `true`.
[!code-cs[Classic HttpCachePolicy.SetSlidingExpiration Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/m-system.web.httpcachepo_0_1.cs)] [!code-vb[Classic HttpCachePolicy.SetSlidingExpiration Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/m-system.web.httpcachepo_0_1.vb)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void SetValidUntilExpires(bool validUntilExpires) cil managed

Docs.param: if the cache ignores invalidation headers; otherwise, .
Docs.summary: Specifies whether the ASP.NET cache should ignore HTTP headers sent by the client that invalidate the cache.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The SetValidUntilExpires method is set to `true` automatically when the high-level `<%@ OutputCache … %>` page directive is used.
This method is provided because some browsers, when refreshing a page view, send HTTP cache invalidation headers to the Web server and evict the page from the cache. When the `validUntilExpires` parameter is `true`, ASP.NET ignores cache invalidation headers and the page remains in the cache until it expires.
SetValidUntilExpires is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the SetValidUntilExpires method to instruct that any cache invalidation headers sent by the client are ignored.
[!code-cs[HttpCachePolicy_SetValidUntilExpires#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/m-system.web.httpcachepo_5_1.aspx)] [!code-vb[HttpCachePolicy_SetValidUntilExpires#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/m-system.web.httpcachepo_5_1.aspx)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void SetVaryByCustom(string custom) cil managed

Docs.param: The text string to vary cached output by.
Docs.summary: Specifies a custom text string to vary cached output responses by.

remarks.format:
## Remarks SetVaryByCustom is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to set the custom vary string to "Accept-Charset", which causes the origin-server's cache to choose one of several cached responses depending on the browser's `Accept-Charset` header.
[!code-vb[Classic HttpCachePolicy.SetVaryByCustom Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/m-system.web.httpcachepo_15_1.vb)] [!code-cs[Classic HttpCachePolicy.SetVaryByCustom Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/m-system.web.httpcachepo_15_1.cs)]

Docs.exception: The SetVaryByCustom method has already been called.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the timestamp in Coordinated Universal Iime (UTC) for the .
Gets the list of headers that will be used to vary the output cache.
Docs.value: An object that specifies which headers are used to select the cached response.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The VaryByContentEncodings property returns a list of Content-Encoding headers that represent compression schemes to vary the output cache by. Caching dynamically compressed responses means that the cost of compression is incurred only one time, during the first request for the resource.
The VaryByContentEncodings property is used with the `Accept-Encoding` header of a request to determine how to serve cached responses for different content encodings that are dynamically compressed. The Accept-Encoding header lists the encodings that the client can decompress.
When you set the cache to vary by content encoding, it lets the response vary indirectly by the value in the `Accept-Encoding` header. When a request is processed, the `Accept-Encoding` header is checked and the first acceptable encoding is identified and used to take one of the following actions:
- If a matching encoding is found in the VaryByContentEncodings list and a cached response exists, the cached response is sent.
- If a matching encoding is found in the VaryByContentEncodings list but a cached response does not exist, a response is generated and inserted into the cache.
- If a matching encoding is not found in the VaryByContentEncodings list, the cache is searched for a non-encoded response, also referred to as the identity response. If the non-encoded response is found, it is sent. Otherwise, a new non-encoded response is generated, sent, and stored in the cache.
For more information about the VaryByContentEncodings property, see "RFC 2616: Hypertext Transfer Protocol -- HTTP/1.1," which is available on the [World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) Web site](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=37125). Information about content encodings is in section 14, "Header Field Definitions."
You can set the VaryByContentEncodings property by using the `VaryByContentEncodings` attribute of the directive. You can also add a cache profile to the element in the Web.config file.
VaryByContentEncodings is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
## Examples The following example shows how to enable a dynamically compressed response for a page to be served from the output cache. The encoding that is acceptable is "gzip" and is set by using the `VaryByContentEncodings` attribute of the directive. If the Web server that is hosting the page does not have dynamic compression enabled, the output cache will not have a cached response that is based on the specified content encoding.
[!code-vb[System.Web.HttpCachePolicy.VaryByContentEncodings#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.web.httpcachepo_1.aspx)] [!code-cs[System.Web.HttpCachePolicy.VaryByContentEncodings#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.web.httpcachepo_1.aspx)]

Docs.summary: Gets the list of all HTTP headers that will be used to vary cache output.
Docs.value: An that specifies which HTTP headers are used to select the cached response.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When a cached item has several vary headers, a separate version of the requested document is available from the cache for each HTTP header type.
VaryByHeaders is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).

Docs.summary: Gets the list of parameters received by an HTTP or HTTP that affect caching.
Docs.value: An that specifies which cache-control headers are used to select the cached response.

remarks.format:
## Remarks A separate version of the requested document is available from the cache for each named parameter in the VaryByParams collection.
VaryByParams is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
